website_summaries.verdict: A well-made, sleek-looking model with few issues considering the budget-friendly price.
pros: Impressive features and performance for a fraction of the cost of others
Sturdy plastic drum, internal aeration, and large barrel size
Many owners commented that they didn't mind having this on display in their gardens and yards
cons: Although assembly is straightforward, it can be a bit challenging to assemble
Plastic wheels are a little rough to move

customer_reviews.title: Made in China and warning for DINP needs to be indicated.
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived opened and beat up. Went together well and it looks good. I had researched the Redmon Company because I wanted to purchase a USA made product. But, when it arrived the sides of the box indicated it was MADE IN CHINA and below that was a Warning - can expose you to chemicals including diisononyl phthalate (DINP) which is known to cause cancer. That does not make me feel comfortable with my environmentally friendly attempt to compost. Have not yet used it, so not sure how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Cancer Free America

customer_reviews.title: Materials contain carcinogens....no thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time on this one, as the large box return is a hassle too. If you’re serious about composting, just splurge and get the Jora composter. I saw this one on a “top 5 composter” list and it was way cheaper than the Jora one, so I figured it’d be a good buy. You get what you pay for, and my whole purpose of creating compost in my backyard was to return even more beneficial matter to the ground....and to think it’s stewing and tumbling along in a Prop 65 bin...I just can’t wrap my head around it. Seems counterintuitive.
customer_reviews.author: allison cochrane

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It arrived with a damaged front lid; but they sent a replacement part relatively quickly ( within the week). Let's see how good the compost turns out! Okay attention to the directions for ratio of dry leaves to food...
customer_reviews.author: Tolaplaya

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The panels collect water within the plastic. Not sure how to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: wyatt

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to assemble but after a few turns the door ...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble but after a few turns the door does not stay latched and I had to use bungee cords to keep it closed
customer_reviews.author: Susan Barry

customer_reviews.title: busted after 2 summers
customer_reviews.text: This compost tumbler busted after only 2 summers of use, see photo. I sent a message to seller over one week ago and have not heard back from them. Very disappointed in this product and would like a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Merrily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small garden!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together but had to refer to image since the instructions weren't super clear. Did need an extra hand to attach the tumbler to the stand. Instructions indicate to put on the door so it opens down, but he image opens up. I chose down since it is easier to load. I try to leave it with the handle down since it is rusting already around the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Krumpet

customer_reviews.title: leaks like a sieve!
customer_reviews.text: Since you have to assemble it yourself, it is not water tight. Needless to say, once the recyclable materials (food etc.) begins to decompose, it leaks and smells. Had to move it far from the house so it is not as convenient and I worry about attracting animals.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after only three months.  Door "hinge" broke off.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after only three months while my ComposTumbler is still going strong after five years. The "hinge" is molded as part of the door and snapped off after less than three months of moderate use. The ComposTumbler is worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Donahue

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a defect. Couldn't reach customer service OR the management. Useless within a year.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pochaw

product_meta.title: Redmon, Gray Green Culture Compost Tumbler, 37 Gallon
product_meta.description: Participate in the environment in a positive way by using Redmon Green Culture products. The Redmon Green Culture compost tumbler is one of the perfect tools to get started. Effective composting requires proper aeration of the compost. Using the Green Culture Compost Tumbler eliminates some of the work since the tumbler rotates easily. The inside agitators help to break up and mix the waste materials for effective easy composting.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars15 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Hex Lock Nut, Door Panel with Handle, V Support Tubes with Plug in One End, Circular End Panel, Handle Tube
